14. Limitation of Liability and Consequential Responsibilities. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary within this Agreement, neither party will bear responsibility for any consequential, indirect, special, incidental, or exemplary damages resulting from this Agreement, regardless of whether such damage was foreseeable or a party has been informed of its potential occurrence. Moreover, while both parties are absolved from liability for lost profits and costs associated with acquiring alternative goods or services, they will remain accountable for any payments due or accrued under Section 8 as per this Agreement. The parties acknowledge that these limitations will apply regardless of the effectiveness of any remedy, including but not limited to claims based on negligence. This agreement does, however, imply an ongoing responsibility for each party to fulfill their contractual obligations diligently.

In essence, while both parties retain a commitment to meet their respective contractual duties, they will not be held liable for any damages beyond the payments due or accrued under Section 8 of this Agreement. Additionally, neither party will bear responsibility for lost profits, procurement costs of substitute goods or services, or any claims made by third parties. In all cases, neither party will be liable for special, indirect, or exemplary damages arising out of or related to this Agreement.

18. Diversified Provisions.

original: (ii)  In the event of any such claim or dispute, the parties shall first attempt to resolve the matter through good faith, informal negotiations, including non-binding mediation. In the event that the parties are unable to resolve the dispute, either party hereto may demand arbitration by written notice to the other party and to the AAA in San Diego. The parties shall mutually agree on one arbitrator. If the parties cannot so agree, the single arbitrator shall be selected by the AAA. The costs of arbitration are to be shared equally by the parties. Each party shall be responsible for its own costs and attorneys' fees.
ollama_generated:
(ii) In the event of any claim or dispute between the parties, it will initially be the responsibility of each party to actively seek resolution through good faith, informal negotiations, and non-binding mediation processes. However, if these efforts prove fruitless and a deadlock persists for a period of 60 days from the commencement of such negotiations, either party may trigger arbitration by providing written notice to the other party and the American Arbitration Association (AAA) in San Diego.

In the event of a disagreement regarding the selection of the arbitrator, the AAA shall appoint the single arbitrator. The costs of initiating the arbitration process shall be equally divided between the parties. Each party will bear their own legal fees and costs throughout the proceedings, with no reimbursement expected from the other.

By shifting the onus of initial resolution efforts onto both parties and imposing a timeframe for these efforts, we aim to encourage proactive problem-solving while also streamlining the arbitration process in case of a prolonged impasse.

EXHIBIT D SYSTEM SPECIFICATIONS

The Service shall facilitate the ability of MBE and MBE Centers to process packages for domestic shipment, measure these packages, and generate shipping labels. The Service will transmit data to a designated Point-of-Sale (POS) station within an MBE Center, while supporting ARS/BIN packages, consignee billing, freight insurance, MBE proprietary or specified transit declared value, and access to the customer address book. It is understood that the MBE Centers retain the responsibility for managing their own mark-ups for shipping, and they are expected to notify the Company of any such modifications. The Company shall endeavor to update its pricing information for each carrier to reflect these changes, but assumes no liability for any discrepancies or delays in doing so. This Exhibit D may be amended unilaterally by either party, with prior written notice, subject to mutual agreement on the revised terms.
